This one is tricky, vitamin B12 is not found in any plant sources. It is actually a micororganism found in soil. Animal meat contains B12 because the food they eat comes straight from the ground, where as humans tend to wash off all the dirt on our produce.[2] However, as a result of living in the 21st century, the vitamin can be reproduced in pill form. You may be skeptical to ingest something made in a lab, but vitamin B12 supplements shouldnâ€™t be viewed any differently than daily multivitamins, fish oil, or other common supplements.
